Oliver Coleman

Field Detail

ERROR_TYPE_KEY

@Deprecated
public static final java.lang.String ERROR_TYPE_KEY
Deprecated. 
The type of error calculation to perform for each input and target output pair. Valid types are:
  • sum: the sum of the differences between each target and actual output value.
  • sum-squared: the sum of the squared differences between each target and actual output value.
  • squared-sum: the squared sum of the differences between each target and actual output value.
  • squared-sum-squared: the squared sum of the squared differences between each target and actual output value.
The preferred method of specifying error type is to use the ERROR_TYPE_TRIAL_KEY and ERROR_TYPE_OUTPUT_KEY properties.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

ERROR_TYPE_TRIAL_KEY

public static final java.lang.String ERROR_TYPE_TRIAL_KEY
The type of error calculation to perform over the error of each trial. Any type in TargetFitnessCalculator.ErrorType may be used. The default is RMSE.

See Also:
ERROR_TYPE_OUTPUT_KEY, Constant Field Values

ERROR_TYPE_OUTPUT_KEY

public static final java.lang.String ERROR_TYPE_OUTPUT_KEY
The type of error calculation to perform over the error of each output. Any type in TargetFitnessCalculator.ErrorType may be used. The default is SAE.

See Also:
ERROR_TYPE_TRIAL_KEY, Constant Field Values

FITNESS_CONVERSION_TYPE_KEY

public static final java.lang.String FITNESS_CONVERSION_TYPE_KEY
The method for calculating a fitness value from the error value. Valid types are:
  • proportional: The fitness is calculated as MAX_FITNESS * (error / MAX_ERROR), where MAX_FITNESS is some large constant and MAX_ERROR is the maximum possible error value.
  • inverse: The fitness is calculated as MAX_FITNESS / (1 + error), where MAX_FITNESS is some large constant.
The default is proportional.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

FITNESS_PERFORMANCE_TYPE_KEY

public static final java.lang.String FITNESS_PERFORMANCE_TYPE_KEY
The method used to calculate the performance. Valid types are:
  • proportional: The performance is calculated as error / MAX_ERROR, where MAX_ERROR is the maximum possible error value.
  • percent-correct: The performance is calculated as the percentage of correct trials (see FITNESS_ACCEPTABLE_ERROR_KEY).
Default is "proportional".

See Also:
Constant Field Values

FITNESS_ACCEPTABLE_ERROR_KEY

public static final java.lang.String FITNESS_ACCEPTABLE_ERROR_KEY
The absolute value that an output can differ from the target output and still be considered correct (i.e. the acceptable error margin). Used for calculating the percentage of trials for which the correct output was given. Default is 0.1.

See Also:

setMaxFitnessValue

public void setMaxFitnessValue(int newMaxFitnessValue)
Sets the maximum possible fitness value this function will return. Default is 1000000 which is fine for nearly all purposes.

Parameters:
newMaxFitnessValue - The new maximum fitness.

evaluate

public TargetFitnessCalculator.Results evaluate(Activator substrate,
                                                java.lang.Object inputPatterns,
                                                java.lang.Object targetOutputPatterns,
                                                double minTargetOutputValue,
                                                double maxTargetOutputValue,
                                                NiceWriter logOutput)
Evaluate the given network on the given input and target output pairs. Currently only 1 or 2 dimensional input and output arrays are supported (thus inputPatterns and targetOutputPatterns can have 2 or 3 dimensions).

Parameters:
substrate - The network to evaluate.
inputPatterns - Array containing stimuli (input) examples, in the form [trial][dN]...[d0]. The dimensions should match those of the input layer of the substrate network.
targetOutputPatterns - Array containing stimuli (input) examples, in the form [trial][dN]...[d0]. The dimensions should match those of the input layer of the substrate network.
minTargetOutputValue - The smallest value that occurs in the target outputs.
maxTargetOutputValue - The largest value that occurs in the target outputs.
logOutput - If not null then for each pattern the input, target and output will be written to this.
Returns:
The calculated fitness value.
